title: Collaborative accountability for sustainable public health: A Korean perspective on the effective use of ICT-based health risk communication
text:
In this respect, this study has identified guiding principles and determining factors behind both government' and citizens' involvement in sustainable public health governance using ICT systems, specifically government social media sites used for health risk communication services
Information-communication technology (ICT) can help governments and their citizens collaborate toward achieving sustainable public health practices
 The purpose of this study is to investigate how to increase government accountability for motivating citizens to engage in ICT-based health risk communication, thereby attaining sustainable public health practices through collaborative governance
authors: Lee, Taejun (David); Park, Hyojung; Lee, Junesoo

title: Basic public health services delivered in an urban community: a qualitative study
text: The findings relate to three main themes: the content of basic public health services, funding support for basic public health services, and the providers who deliver basic public health services
